definition: in a wink
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: He was gone in a trice.
But before too long, Kathleen had cajoled him onto the back of the jet ski.
sentences.chinese: 但才一转眼，凯萨琳已经把马克骗上水上摩托车后座。

sentences.english: He was here just now, but disappeared in a flash.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚还在这里的，一转眼就不见了。

sentences.english: The race started. the rabbit darted almost out of sight at once.
sentences.chinese: 比赛开始了，免子猛冲出去，简直一转眼就不见了。

sentences.english: In a twinkling, Montparnasse had become unrecognizable.
sentences.chinese: 一转眼，巴纳斯山已变成另一个人。

sentences.english: 2a flash of God, a twinkling of an eye, so we vertical chuilao.
sentences.chinese: 一晃神，一转眼，我们就这样垂垂老去。

sentences.english: Faster than a good time, a twinkling of an eye on this one and a half months have passed.
sentences.chinese: 时间过的好快，一转眼一个半月就这样过去了。

sentences.english: Six years have slipped by since I came from thecountry to the capital.
sentences.chinese: 我从乡下跑到京城里，一转眼已经六年了。

sentences.english: And in a fraction of a second, a drunk driver had taken all this away from him.
sentences.chinese: 就在一转眼工夫，一位醉酒司机夺去了他的所有。

sentences.english: One year had passed since my last trip here.
sentences.chinese: 一转眼，距上次到北京已经一年多了。

sentences.english: Within a blink of eye, I was standing right there, the beach of the Great East Sea.
sentences.chinese: 一转眼功夫，我已站在大东海的海滩上。

definition: in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
in a wink
(of passing time) in an instant/(of a sight) in a flash
unconsciously/unwittingly
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
circumstances/scene/about/probably
soon/in a moment/to look on as sth happens
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
in a flash (idiom)
almost/nearly/almost all
period of time (may be months, or mere seconds)/spare time/skill/labor/effort
(old) laborer
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant
whole/full
Here we go again.
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
